results.title: Action-reaction
results.brief_description: A study of the changing approach to the teaching of physical education in Victorian secondary schools. Shows how the highly competitive and restrictive activities of cricket and football have been augmented by a wide range of both popular and unusual sports which allow the student to develop within his own capacity.

results.title: Acting problems
results.creator_credit: Wesley Greene, International Film Bureau, Robert Edmonds and Betty Edmonds
results.brief_description: Dr Maurice Griesen directs four actors from the Goodman Memorial Theatre in scenes from “Tom Sawyer”. He discusses the actor’s problem of achieving characterization and theatrical terms such as improvisation and rhythm tempo.

results.title: Acting class
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor and John Smith
results.brief_description: For anyone who has ever wondered what it takes to become an actor, the film provides a close-up of a craft that demands much from body and mind. An energetic and intense film which looks in at students and instructors as they sweat and strain through a typical workday at the National Theatre School - Canada’s foremost training ground for performers.

results.title: Acting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Shows a stage actor during audition and his transition to a motion picture actor. Well known actors including Helen Hayes, Vincent Price, Henry Fonda, Jim Backus, Jean Stapleton, Jeff Corey, Royal Dano, Mariette Hartley, Janet McLachlan and Paul Newman appear and discuss problem areas that a film actor must deal with.

results.title: Act of no choice
results.creator_credit: Kino Eye Pictures and Mark Worth
results.brief_description: This video tells the tragic story of West Papua through the eyes of Arie Van Klinken : a Dutch patrol officer in the 50s and 60s ; William Zongannau: a prominent West Papuan politician in the 1960s ; and Hugh Lunn: the only living journalist who witnessed the farcical ‘Act of Free Choice” for West Papua in 1969. Through access to secret documents, the film uncovers how Australia colluded with Indonesia to keep the so called “Act of Free Choice” a secret from the outside world. Contains Dutch home movies, newsreel footage and previously unseen film coverage of the “Act of Free Choice”. Music by David Bridie and Arthur Lyman.

results.title: Act of necessity
results.creator_credit: Pamela Williams, Film Australia, Channel 4 and Ian Munro
results.brief_description: Act of necessity, set in rural New South Wales, explores the conflicts faced by a community whose health is threatened by the use of chemical sprays. One woman’s concerns are brought to a climax when her daughter becomes fatally ill and her search for answers is frustrated by a wall of bureaucracy. Beautifully photographed, it provides a compelling argument about the dangers of chemicals to the environment and the collusion of silence from people in power.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pamela Williams, Film Australia, Channel 4 and Ian Munro

results.title: Act of God: some lightning experiences 1966-1980
results.creator_credit: Udi Eichler, Peter Greenaway and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Take Six”.
An investigation of lightning as an arbitrary intervention in people’s lives, with devastating consequences. It is made disconcerting by the idiosyncratic combination of the bizarre and the everyday. While the film technique is sophisticated, much of it is very amusing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Udi Eichler, Peter Greenaway and Thames Television

results.title: Across the Strait
results.creator_credit: Robert Horne, Ken Taylor and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
The Cape Barren goose one of the world’s rarest species, is found on the island in Bass Strait. Looks at the birds in their natural environment and describes their varying fortunes at the hands of man. Other birds filmed include Pacific gulls, cormorants, black swans, the chestnut teal and the spur-winged plover also emphasising research by Dr. Dorward on Glennie Island.
